title: Meat ring
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Meat_ring/zh-CN "Meat ring/zh-CN")

| % [![Meat ring.png](/images/b/b1/Meat_ring.png)](/wiki/File:Meat_ring.png) |                                       |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                       | meat ring                             |
| Base price                                                                 | 5 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")       |
| Nutrition                                                                  | [5](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")      |
| Turns to eat                                                               | 1                                     |
| Weight                                                                     | [1](/wiki/Weight "Weight")            |
| Conduct                                                                    | [meat](/wiki/Conduct#Vegan "Conduct") |

A **meat ring** is a type of [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is [fleshy](/wiki/Fleshy "Fleshy") and not [vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian") or vegan.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 List of mineral and gemstone rings](#List_of_mineral_and_gemstone_rings)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Messages](#Messages)
- [6 Variants](#Variants)
  - [6.1 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
- [7 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Meat rings are not randomly generated, and can only created by [zapping](/wiki/Zap "Zap") a [stone to flesh](/wiki/Spellbook_of_stone_to_flesh "Spellbook of stone to flesh") [spell](/wiki/Spell "Spell") at a [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") with a [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") that is made of [mineral](/wiki/Mineral "Mineral") or [gemstone](/wiki/Gemstone "Gemstone").

## Description

When [eaten](/wiki/Eaten "Eaten"), meat rings grant 5 base [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition"). Like [tripe rations](/wiki/Tripe_ration "Tripe ration"), meat rings are considered a [treat](/wiki/Treat "Treat") for [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet"), and they can be thrown to tame carnivorous [domestic animals](/wiki/Domestic_animal "Domestic animal").

Meat rings can be worn like normal rings, but have no effect and do not incur [ring hunger](/wiki/Ring_hunger "Ring hunger"). [Dropping](/wiki/Dropping "Dropping") a meat ring down a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink") prints a message, but has no other effect.

## Strategy

Like [meat sticks](/wiki/Meat_stick "Meat stick"), most meat rings are [junk](/wiki/Junk "Junk") created from a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") zapping stone to flesh at themselves, either by accident or deliberately to cure [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning"). A meat ring provides very little nutrition, and is best used as a lightweight treat to feed any meat-eating pets or else tame carnivorous [domestic animals](/wiki/Domestic_animal "Domestic animal") - they can also be used as [polyfodder](/wiki/Polyfodder "Polyfodder") to try and turn into lightweight food such as [lembas wafers](/wiki/Lembas_wafer "Lembas wafer").

If you cannot uncurse a cursed mineral or gemstone ring any other way, a viable method is to drop all *other* mineral and gemstone items and then cast stone to flesh on yourself - the cursed ring can then be eaten off your finger, with the only remaining concern being adverse effects of [rotten food](/wiki/Food#rotten_food "Food").

### List of mineral and gemstone rings

Rings with the following randomized appearances can be turned into meat rings:

- agate
- black onyx
- clay
- coral
- diamond
- emerald
- granite
- jade
- moonstone
- opal
- ruby
- sapphire
- tiger eye
- topaz

## History

The meat ring is introduced alongside the spell of stone to flesh in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Messages

- Several flies buzz around the sink.

  You dropped a meat ring into a sink.

## Variants

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), meat rings can be randomly generated, and can be sold in general [stores](/wiki/Store "Store") and delicatessens.

## Encyclopedia entry

- *See the [encyclopedia entry for meatball](/wiki/Meatball#Encyclopedia_entry "Meatball").*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Meat ring

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
%
Name meat ring
Base price 5 zm
Nutrition 5
Turns to eat 1
Weight 1
Conduct meat

A meat ring is a type of comestible that appears in NetHack. It is fleshy and not vegetarian or vegan.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 List of mineral and gemstone rings
  • 4 History
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SlashTHEM
  • 7 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

Meat rings are not randomly generated, and can only created by zapping a stone to flesh spell at a ring with a randomized appearance that is made of mineral or gemstone.

Description

When eaten, meat rings grant 5 base nutrition. Like tripe rations, meat rings are considered a treat for carnivorous pets, and they can be thrown to tame carnivorous domestic animals.

Meat rings can be worn like normal rings, but have no effect and do not incur ring hunger. Dropping a meat ring down a sink prints a message, but has no other effect.

Strategy

Like meat sticks, most meat rings are junk created from a hero zapping stone to flesh at themselves, either by accident or deliberately to cure stoning. A meat ring provides very little nutrition, and is best used as a lightweight treat to feed any meat-eating pets or else tame carnivorous domestic animals - they can also be used as polyfodder to try and turn into lightweight food such as lembas wafers.

If you cannot uncurse a cursed mineral or gemstone ring any other way, a viable method is to drop all other mineral and gemstone items and then cast stone to flesh on yourself - the cursed ring can then be eaten off your finger, with the only remaining concern being adverse effects of rotten food.

List of mineral and gemstone rings

Rings with the following randomized appearances can be turned into meat rings:

  • agate
  • black onyx
  • clay
  • coral
  • diamond
  • emerald
  • granite
  • jade
  • moonstone
  • opal
  • ruby
  • sapphire
  • tiger eye
  • topaz

History

The meat ring is introduced alongside the spell of stone to flesh in NetHack 3.3.0.

Messages

Several flies buzz around the sink.
You dropped a meat ring into a sink.

Variants

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, meat rings can be randomly generated, and can be sold in general stores and delicatessens.

Encyclopedia entry

See the encyclopedia entry for meatball.

A '''meat ring''' is a type of [[comestible]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is [[fleshy]] and not [[vegetarian]] or vegan.

==Generation==
Meat rings are not randomly generated, and can only created by [[zap]]ping a {{spell of|stone to flesh}} [[spell]] at a [[ring]] with a [[randomized appearance]] that is made of [[mineral]] or [[gemstone]].

==Description==
When [[eaten]], meat rings grant 5 base [[nutrition]]. Like [[tripe ration]]s, meat rings are considered a [[treat]] for [[carnivorous]] [[pet]]s, and they can be thrown to tame carnivorous [[domestic animal]]s.

Meat rings can be worn like normal rings, but have no effect and do not incur [[ring hunger]]. [[Dropping]] a meat ring down a [[sink]] prints a message, but has no other effect.

==Strategy==
Like [[meat stick]]s, most meat rings are [[junk]] created from a [[hero]] zapping stone to flesh at themselves, either by accident or deliberately to cure [[stoning]]. A meat ring provides very little nutrition, and is best used as a lightweight treat to feed any meat-eating pets or else tame carnivorous [[domestic animal]]s - they can also be used as [[polyfodder]] to try and turn into lightweight food such as [[lembas wafer]]s.

If you cannot uncurse a cursed mineral or gemstone ring any other way, a viable method is to drop all ''other'' mineral and gemstone items and then cast stone to flesh on yourself - the cursed ring can then be eaten off your finger, with the only remaining concern being adverse effects of [[Food#rotten food|rotten food]].

===List of mineral and gemstone rings===
Rings with the following randomized appearances can be turned into meat rings:

* agate
* black onyx
* clay
* coral
* diamond
* emerald
* granite
* jade
* moonstone
* opal
* ruby
* sapphire
* tiger eye
* topaz

==History==
The meat ring is introduced alongside the spell of stone to flesh in [[NetHack 3.3.0]].

==Messages==

==Variants==
===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], meat rings can be randomly generated, and can be sold in general [[store]]s and delicatessens.
